FuncDef:
The whitelist session-car telnet-server disable command disables the Telnet whitelist session CAR function.
The undo whitelist session-car telnet-server disable command restores the Telnet whitelist session CAR function.
By default, the Telnet whitelist session CAR function is enabled.
Examples: Warning: When a device receives a large number of packets, the packets of different sessions may preempt the bandwidth of each other. You are advised not to disable this function.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The Telnet session CAR function is enabled by default. It isolates packet channels between Telnet Server sessions.
To disable this function on a device, run the whitelist session-car telnet-server disable command. Telnet Server packets received by this device will be sent directly to the CPCAR channel. If the device receives a large number of Telnet Server packets, packets from different Telnet Server sessions may preempt bandwidth resources. Therefore, disabling this function is not usually recommended.
